results.title: Nerida Anderson, 1939
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Three of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. Set in 1939, this episode examines attempts by Nerida Anderson and her family to improve conditions on the Aboriginal Reserve where they live. Such attempts and displays of independence outrage the manager. He has Nerida and her family tried for treason. Realising a no-win situation, the entire population of the reserve pack their belongings and leave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Maydina the shadow 1890's
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Two of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. This episode examines the life of Maydina and her daughter on a church mission run by a self-appointed guardian at the turn of the century. Follows her struggle to return to a tribal existence and her efforts to prevent her daughter being taken away from her by the mission guardian.

results.title: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australia Council and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Peter Carey is one of Australia’s most talented writers. All four of his published works have won major literary awards. This film, takes a journey through his life and work and looks at the way he transforms his native country into a bizarre land of nightmares and surreal comedy. Throughout the film, an interview with Peter Carey is interwoven with lavish dramatisation. An intriguing and illuminating film about a remarkable writer.

results.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Protecting Our Greatest Asset”.
It should be noted that this video is made by a chemical company that manufactures herbicides. Intensive cropping and continual cultivation stresses the Australian soil dramatically. This video looks at alternative methods to soil tillage by machinery, namely herbicides. Crops which require no tillage as conservation are also discussed.

results.title: Patterns
results.brief_description: Patterns is a documentary which explores issues to do with politics, work, art and women’s history. A number of threads are woven between the sweatshop and the art gallery, the glory box and the political banner, bourgeois femininity and the question: should a feminist knit? An incisive and kaleidoscopic exploration of needlework and its place in women’s lives.

results.title: Fifty fifty
results.creator_credit: Carole Sklan and Face Value Productions
results.brief_description: Flashing back and forth between the Fifties and the Eighties, the film explores with wit and panache the political and social connections between the two eras, converting a potential nostalgia trip into a sharply focused but entertaining analysis of the pressure placed on men and women then and now.

results.title: Voices of Malaya
results.creator_credit: Ralth Eaton, Terry Trench, Central Office of Information and Colonial Office
results.brief_description: Voices of Malaya was made before hostilities in Malaya began, in the period immediately after World War 2. It is primarily a background study of the problems facing a country with a population of five million people - Malayan, Chinese-Malayan, Indian-Malayan and European - who are suffering from the aftermath of war. It shows the efforts of the mixed nationalities of Malaya working and living together in the best interests of their country. Music by Elizabeth Lutyens, played by The Philharmonic Orchestra and conducted by John Hollingsworth.

results.title: Report on Eppalock
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols, Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Lake Eppalock, and its catchment area are the base for a unique water and soil conservation scheme. The area in the past has suffered severe erosion due to gold mining and bad farming. The aims of this long term project are to heal erosion, conserve water, reclaim land and increase farming production with the co-operation of land holders, shire councils and various Government departments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rothols, Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Where she belongs...
results.brief_description: Nikki Butler pays tribute to her Nana, a strong, knowledgeable Aboriginal women. Despite being a part of the Stolen Generation and growing up away from her land, Nana has taught Butler so much about her heritage, culture and land. Butler hopes to be with her when Nana does finally return home.
